title: Ringan Gilhaize, or, The Covenanters
author: Galt, John
snippet: To this the seneschal added, "I fear, I fear, we are soon to haveanother scene of the same sort, for to-morrow the Bishops of Murray, andBrechin, and Caithness, with other dignitaries, are summoned to thecathedral to sit in judgment on the aged priest of Lunan, that wasbrought hither from Dysart yestereen, and from the head the newfangledheresies are making, there's little doubt that the poor auld man will bemade an example.

title: Ringan Gilhaize, or, The Covenanters
author: Galt, John
snippet: Nae farther gane thanyesterday, auld worthy Mr Mill of Lunan, being discovered hidden in akiln at Dysart, was ta'en, they say, in a cart, like a malefactor, bytwa uncircumcised loons, servitors to his Grace, and it's thought itwill go hard wi' him on account of his great godliness; so mak whathaste ye dow, and the Lord put mettle in the beast that bears you."

title: Ringan Gilhaize, or, The Covenanters
author: Galt, John
snippet: To this the seneschal added, "I fear, I fear, we are soon to haveanother scene of the same sort, for to-morrow the Bishops of Murray, andBrechin, and Caithness, with other dignitaries, are summoned to thecathedral to sit in judgment on the aged priest of Lunan, that wasbrought hither from Dysart yestereen, and from the head the newfangledheresies are making, there's little doubt that the poor auld man will bemade an example.

title: Ringan Gilhaize, or, The Covenanters
author: Galt, John
snippet: Nae farther gane thanyesterday, auld worthy Mr Mill of Lunan, being discovered hidden in akiln at Dysart, was ta'en, they say, in a cart, like a malefactor, bytwa uncircumcised loons, servitors to his Grace, and it's thought itwill go hard wi' him on account of his great godliness; so mak whathaste ye dow, and the Lord put mettle in the beast that bears you."

title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: Lunan, a river of Scotland, in Perthshire, which has its rise in the Grampian

title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: Lunan Bay, a fine bay on the coast ofScotland, Forfarshire, at the mouth of theriver Lunan.

title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: Lunan, a river of Scotland, in Forfarshire, which, after a course of 12 or 14miles, falls into the German ocean.

title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: Lunan, a parish of Scotland, in Forfarshire, lying on the bay of that name, alongthe shore of the German ocean.

title: Auld licht idylls.
author: Barrie, J. M.
snippet: DAVIT LUNAN's political REMINISCENCES.

title: Auld licht idylls.
author: Barrie, J. M.
snippet: " I've heard say," remarked Jamie, putting it this way so as not to tie himself down to anything,  *' 'at Bell's scones is equal to Mag Lunan's."

title: Auld licht idylls.
author: Barrie, J. M.
snippet: dragging the plank over the wall, with Davit Lunan on the top directing them, when they seem to have let go and sent the tinsmith suddenly  into the air.

title: Auld licht idylls.
author: Barrie, J. M.
snippet: This was proved by Davit Lunan, tinsmith, whom I have heard tell the story.

title: Auld licht idylls.
author: Barrie, J. M.
snippet: The insult to Lunan's coffin,  however, dispirited their weavers for a time, and not until the suicide of Pitlums did they put much fervor into their prayers.

title: Auld licht idylls.
author: Barrie, J. M.
snippet: In conveying Lunan s remains to the borders of his own parish, they were only conforming to custom ; but Thrums and Tilliedrum  differed as to where the boundary-line was drawn, and not a foot would either advance into the other's territory.

title: Auld licht idylls.
author: Barrie, J. M.
snippet: By-and-bye half a dozen men drew near from the opposite direction, bearing on poles the remains  of Tammas Lunan in a closed coffin.

title: Auld licht idylls.
author: Barrie, J. M.
snippet: The mustard-seed of a feud between the two parishes, shot into a tall tree in a single night, when Davit Lunan's father went to a tattie roup at Tilliedrum and thoughtlessly died there.

title: Auld licht idylls.
author: Barrie, J. M.
snippet: An Auld Licht would have taken no man's blood without the conviction that he would be the better morally for the bleeding ; and if Tammas Lunan's case gave an impetus to the blows, it can only have been because it opened wider Auld Lichts, eyes to Tilliedrum's desperate condition.

title: Auld licht idylls.
author: Barrie, J. M.
snippet: At eleven o'clock Davit Lunan cracked a joke.

title: Auld licht idylls.
author: Barrie, J. M.
snippet: Davit Lunan got behind his handkerchief to think for a moment, and the minister was on him like a tiger.

title: Auld licht idylls.
author: Barrie, J. M.
snippet: Tammas Haggart and Pete Lunan dander into sight bareheaded, and have to stretch out their hands to discover what the weather is like.
